    <item>
      <title>Shark numbers data renews WA cull debate</title>
      <description><![CDATA[The federal environment minister wants WA to take a tougher stance on sharks following a CSIRO study, but the state government refuses to change its approach.]]></description>

    <item>
      <title>Soccer, cricket and golf handicapped by UK climate change - study</title>
      <description><![CDATA[OSLO (Reuters) - Golf, cricket and soccer are suffering from wetter weather linked to climate change in Britain, the nation which laid down the modern rules for the games, a study said on Wednesday.]]></description>
      <link>https://www.sbs.com.au/news/soccer-cricket-and-golf-handicapped-by-uk-climate-change-study</link>
      <guid>https://www.sbs.com.au/news/soccer-cricket-and-golf-handicapped-by-uk-climate-change-study</guid>

      <category><![CDATA[Science ]]></category>
    </item>
    <item>
      <title>Carbon-sucking technologies 'limited'</title>
      <description><![CDATA[Technologies to capture carbon emissions from the atmosphere have "limited realistic potential" to help avoid dangerous climate change, scientists warn.]]></description>

      <title>Surfers more likely to carry antibiotic resistant E.coli in gut</title>

    <item>
      <title>Global heat waves in 2016 resulted purely from human-driven climate change: study</title>
      <description><![CDATA[Last year's global heat record, extreme heat in Asia and unusually warm waters off the coast of Alaska happened purely because the planet is getting warmer because of human activities like burning fossil fuels, a study said Wednesday.

]]></description>
      <link>https://www.sbs.com.au/news/global-heat-waves-in-2016-resulted-purely-from-human-driven-climate-change-study</link>

    <item>
      <title>Bleak outlook for platypuses in Vic river</title>
      <description><![CDATA[A study looking for the elusive platypus in a Victorian river has found no trace of the much-loved duck-billed monotreme and says it is "functionally extinct".]]></description>
      <link>https://www.sbs.com.au/news/bleak-outlook-for-platypuses-in-vic-river</link>

    <item>
      <title>Is your tap water safe? Calls for more research on the dangers of plastic fibres</title>
      <description><![CDATA[A leading ecologist has called for more investigation into the health impacts of microfibres in Australia as new tests revealed 83 per cent of samples taken from across the world were contaminated by the pollutant.]]></description>
      <link>https://www.sbs.com.au/news/is-your-tap-water-safe-calls-for-more-research-on-the-dangers-of-plastic-fibres</link>
